## Pengantar

Ini adalah lagu untuk seseorang yang belum (atau mungkin tidak akan pernah) saya temui. Sebuah cerita tentang harapan yang mungkin absurd, namun tetap terasa nyata di kepala. 

*Terinspirasi dari gaya musik TV Girl dan Radiohead—melankolis, nostalgia, dan sedikit ironis.*

---

## **"Ghost in My Playlist"**

### Verse 1
```
I saw you in a coffee shop that doesn't exist  
Sitting by the window with your morning mist  
You looked at me like you knew my name  
But I woke up and you were just a frame  
```

### Chorus
```
You're a ghost in my playlist  
A song I can't forget  
Playing on repeat in my head  
But you're someone I haven't met yet  

You're the one I write about at 3 AM  
When the world is quiet and I'm talking to myself again  
I know it's pathetic, I know it's sad  
But you're the best conversation I never had  
```

### Verse 2
```
I built you from the movies and the books I read  
A little bit of fiction, a lot of what I need  
You laugh at all my jokes, you understand my silence  
But you live inside my mind—such a perfect alliance  
```

### Chorus
```
You're a ghost in my playlist  
A song I can't forget  
Playing on repeat in my head  
But you're someone I haven't met yet  

You're the one I write about at 3 AM  
When the world is quiet and I'm talking to myself again  
I know it's pathetic, I know it's sad  
But you're the best conversation I never had  
```

### Bridge
```
Maybe one day I'll find someone real  
Who makes me forget how this feels  
But until then, I'll keep you here  
In my headphones, crystal clear  
```

### Outro
```
So here's to you, whoever you are  
A distant light, a fading star  
I'll keep singing this song in vain  
Until you show up, or I go insane  
```

---

## Refleksi

Ya, saya tahu ini agak menyedihkan. Menulis lagu untuk seseorang yang tidak ada terdengar seperti plot film indie yang gagal. Tapi kadang imajinasi lebih aman daripada kenyataan, kan? Setidaknya dalam imajinasi, tidak ada yang menolak atau mengecewakan.

Mungkin suatu hari nanti, seseorang yang nyata akan muncul dan membuat lagu ini terasa konyol. Atau mungkin tidak. Either way, ini adalah bagian dari siapa saya sekarang—seseorang yang masih mencari, masih berharap, dan masih cukup naif untuk percaya bahwa ada seseorang di luar sana.

*Dan ya, saya sadar betapa self-deprecating ini kedengarannya. Tapi setidaknya saya jujur, bukan?*
